name: QueryJob
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob
description:
QueryJob

A Job subclass representing a query operation that may be performed on a Table. A QueryJob instance is created when you call Project#query_job, Dataset#query_job.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new

job = bigquery.query_job "SELECT COUNT(word) as count FROM " \
                         "publicdata.samples.shakespeare"

job.wait_until_done!

if job.failed?
  puts job.error
else
  puts job.data.first
end

methods.name: batch?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#batch?
methods.description: Checks if the priority for the query is BATCH.

methods.name: interactive?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#interactive?
methods.description: Checks if the priority for the query is INTERACTIVE.

methods.name: large_results?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#large_results?
methods.description: Checks if the the query job allows arbitrarily large results at a slight cost to performance.

returns.description: true when large results are allowed, false otherwise.

methods.name: cache?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#cache?
methods.description: Checks if the query job looks for an existing result in the query cache. For more information, see Query Caching.

returns.description: true when the query cache will be used, false otherwise.

methods.name: flatten?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#flatten?
methods.description: Checks if the query job flattens nested and repeated fields in the query results. The default is true. If the value is false, #large_results? should return true.

returns.description: true when the job flattens results, false otherwise.

methods.name: maximum_billing_tier
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#maximum_billing_tier
methods.description: Limits the billing tier for this job. Queries that have resource usage beyond this tier will fail (without incurring a charge). If unspecified, this will be set to your project default. For more information, see High-Compute queries.

returns.description: The tier number, or nil for the project default.

methods.name: maximum_bytes_billed
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#maximum_bytes_billed
methods.description: Limits the bytes billed for this job. Queries that will have bytes billed beyond this limit will fail (without incurring a charge). If nil, this will be set to your project default.

returns.description: The number of bytes, or nil for the project default.

methods.name: cache_hit?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#cache_hit?
methods.description: Checks if the query results are from the query cache.

returns.description: true when the job statistics indicate a cache hit, false otherwise.

methods.name: bytes_processed
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#bytes_processed
methods.description: The number of bytes processed by the query.

returns.description: Total bytes processed for the job.

methods.name: query_plan
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#query_plan
methods.description: Describes the execution plan for the query.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new

sql = "SELECT word FROM publicdata.samples.shakespeare"
job = bigquery.query_job sql

job.wait_until_done!

stages = job.query_plan
stages.each do |stage|
  puts stage.name
  stage.steps.each do |step|
    puts step.kind
    puts step.substeps.inspect
  end
end

returns.description:
An array
containing the stages of the execution plan.

methods.name: destination
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#destination
methods.description: The table in which the query results are stored.

methods.name: legacy_sql?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#legacy_sql?
methods.description: Checks if the query job is using legacy sql.

returns.description: true when legacy sql is used, false otherwise.

methods.name: standard_sql?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#standard_sql?
methods.description: Checks if the query job is using standard sql.

returns.description: true when standard sql is used, false otherwise.

methods.name: udfs
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#udfs
methods.description: The user-defined function resources used in the query. May be either a code resource to load from a Google Cloud Storage URI (gs://bucket/path), or an inline resource that contains code for a user-defined function (UDF). Providing an inline code resource is equivalent to providing a URI for a file containing the same code. See User-Defined Functions.

returns.description:
An array containing Google Cloud Storage URIs
and/or inline source code.

methods.name: wait_until_done!
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#wait_until_done!
methods.description: Refreshes the job until the job is DONE. The delay between refreshes will incrementally increase.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new

sql = "SELECT word FROM publicdata.samples.shakespeare"
job = bigquery.query_job sql

job.wait_until_done!
job.done? #=> true

methods.name: data
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
QueryJob#data
methods.description: Retrieves the query results for the job.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new

sql = "SELECT word FROM publicdata.samples.shakespeare"
job = bigquery.query_job sql

job.wait_until_done!
data = job.data
data.each do |row|
  puts row[:word]
end
data = data.next if data.next?

params.name: token
params.description:
Page token, returned by a previous call,
identifying the result set.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of results to return.

params.name: start
params.description: Zero-based index of the starting row to read.

returns.description:
An object providing access to
data read from the destination table for the job.
